sprint.title: Brand + Landing Page v1 (Conversion Ready)
sprint.goal: Ship a stunning, fast, SEO-ready landing page that captures leads and routes users into the app start flow.
definitionOfDone: Landing page deployed on Vercel with custom domain
Core sections implemented per LP JSON spec

stackAssumptions.ui: Tailwind + shadcn/ui (or MUI if already standard)

backlog.title: Finalize brand direction: name, tagline, and tone

outputs: Top-level nav labels (e.g., How it works, Templates, Pricing, FAQ)

acceptanceTests: brand.json exists and is referenced by landing config
Hero headline and subheadline align with brand tone
Navigation labels finalized and consistent across sections

backlog.title: Set up landing page architecture and section composition

outputs: Component structure: sections as independent components
constraints: No backend dependency required for initial render
No layout shift from images (use next/image with sizes)

acceptanceTests: All sections render on / with clean scroll and no broken links
Content can be edited via a single config file without code changes in components
No CLS regressions due to image loading

backlog.title: Implement stunning 'modern-luxury' visual system (tokens + theming)

outputs: Design tokens: spacing, radius, typography scale
Color system: neutral + 1 accent (gold-like) + 1 deep base (navy/emerald-like)
Reusable primitives: Button, Card, Badge, SectionHeader

acceptanceTests: Landing uses consistent radius/shadow/typography across all cards and CTAs
Buttons have hover/focus/disabled states
Reduced-motion users see minimal/no animations

backlog.title: Add motion polish (hero, scroll reveals, micro-interactions)

animations: Hero visual subtle float/tilt on hover (desktop)
Pricing card hover lift + CTA emphasis
constraints: No heavy parallax that harms performance
Disable or simplify motion when prefers-reduced-motion=true

acceptanceTests: Animations feel smooth at 60fps on a mid-range laptop
No scroll-jank on mobile
Reduced-motion mode shows static alternatives

backlog.title: Implement SEO + metadata + structured data (Product + FAQ)

constraints: No misleading claims (e.g., QR codes available now if not shipped)

acceptanceTests: View-source contains OG tags and Twitter tags
JSON-LD validates for FAQPage
Sitemap and robots are reachable

backlog.title: Email capture v1 (waitlist) with storage + spam protection

requirements.approach: Use a lightweight Next.js route handler to store emails (temporary storage). Upgrade to Supabase table in Sprint 3/4.

acceptanceTests: Submitting a valid email returns success and logs/stores the entry
Bot submissions via honeypot are rejected
Repeated submissions are rate-limited

backlog.title: Analytics instrumentation for landing funnel (PostHog or GA4)
acceptanceTests: Events fire once per interaction (no duplicates on rerender)
UTM/referrer props included when available
Privacy-friendly defaults (no PII beyond email on waitlist endpoint)

backlog.title: Create legal + support stubs (Privacy, Terms, Contact)

contact: simple contact form optional (can be mailto for Sprint 1)
constraints: Keep content minimal and honest (Phase 1: PDF export, media upload later)
Add note about user content ownership and deletion request path

acceptanceTests: Footer links work and pages render
No broken routes
Contact path is clear

backlog.title: Performance pass + Lighthouse gate

tactics: Font strategy (system font or optimized webfont)

acceptanceTests: Lighthouse scores meet or exceed targets
No console errors in production build
No large layout shift on load

backlog.title: Vercel deployment + environment setup + release checklist

setup: Env vars for analytics + waitlist route

acceptanceTests: Production deployment is live and stable
Preview URLs work for PRs
Release checklist completed and recorded
deliverables: vercel env var list in docs

notes: Sprint 1 intentionally avoids Supabase/R2 integration (those start Sprint 3+).
Waitlist storage can be file/kv/email-service initially; migrate to Supabase later without changing UI.
